00030 Codabar::Codabar( string *data )
00031 {
00032         filename = "Basic.xml";
00033         parsed_xml.parse< 0 >( getXMLToParse( &filename ) );
00034         
00035         setDataLength( -1 ); //variable length symbol
00036         //verify
00037          if ( verifyData( data ) )
00038          {
00039                  //data
00040                  encodeSymbol( data );
00041                  //check char
00042                  encodeCheckCharacter( data );
00043                  //start/stop
00044                  encodeStartStop( );
00045                  //quiet zones
00046                  encodeQuietZones( ); 
00047          }
00048          else 
00049          {
00050                  cerr << "Data verification failed" << endl;
00051          }
00052 }

00056         
00057 }

00059 bool Codabar::verifyContent ( const string *content )
00060 {
00061         //** setup acceptable content **
00062         string ASCIIstring = "0123456789$+-./:";
00063         set< char > setOfASCII;
00064         set< char > ::iterator iter;
00065         for ( int nn = 0; nn < ASCIIstring.length( ); nn++ ) 
00066         {
00067                 setOfASCII.insert( ASCIIstring.at( nn ) );
00068         }
00069         //** check the incoming string **
00070         for ( int nn = 0; nn < content->length( ); nn++ ) 
00071         {
00072                 iter = setOfASCII.find( content->at( nn ) );
00073                 if (iter == setOfASCII.end( ) ) 
00074                 {
00075                         cerr << "You are trying to encode " << content->at( nn ) << " which is not supported by this barcode type." << endl;
00076                         return false;
00077                 }
00078         }
00079         return true; 
00080 }
00081 
00082 void Codabar::encodeSymbol ( const string *data )
00083 {
00084         xml_node< > *node = NULL;
00085         
00086         //** make an array of the ascii value of each char in the string **
00087         const string *incomingString = data;
00088         int stringLength = incomingString->length( );
00089         int asciiList[ stringLength ];
00090         
00091         //** loop thru the data and fill the array with its ascii values. **
00092         for ( int ii = 0; ii < stringLength; ii++ ) 
00093         {
00094                 unsigned char eachChar = incomingString->at( ii );
00095                 asciiList[ ii ] = ( int )eachChar;
00096         }
00097         
00098         for ( int jj = 0; jj < stringLength; ++jj ) 
00099         {
00100                 string firstBit = kASCII;
00101                 int kk = asciiList[ jj ];
00102                 string secondBit;
00103                 stringstream out;
00104                 out << kk;
00105                 secondBit = out.str( );
00106                 out.flush( );
00107                 firstBit.append( secondBit );
00108                 
00109                 string ASCIIRef = kASCII;
00110                 string returnedData;
00111                 
00112                 node = parsed_xml.first_node( )->first_node( )->next_sibling( "data_encoding" )->first_node( firstBit.c_str( ) )->first_node( "CodaBar" );
00113                 returnedData = node->value( );
00114                 vector< int > *pattern = stringToVector( returnedData );
00115                 
00116                 Symbol *aSymbol = createSymbol( 0, 1, 1, 0, pattern ); 
00117                 BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( aSymbol );
00118                 
00119                 delete pattern;
00120         }       
00121 }
00122 
00123 void Codabar::encodeStartStop ( )
00124 {
00125         string returnedData;
00126         xml_node< > *node = parsed_xml.first_node( )->first_node( )->next_sibling( "non_data_encoding" )->first_node( "start_char" )->first_node( "CodaBar" )->first_node( "A" );
00127         returnedData = node->value( );
00128         
00129         vector< int > *pattern = stringToVector( returnedData );
00130         
00131         Symbol *startstopSymbol = createSymbol( 4, 1, 1, 0, pattern );
00132         BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( startstopSymbol, 0 );
00133         BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( startstopSymbol, BaseBarcode::encodedSymbols.size( ) );
00134 }
00135 
00136 void Codabar::encodeQuietZones ( )
00137 {
00138         string returnedData;
00139         xml_node< > *node = parsed_xml.first_node( )->first_node( )->next_sibling( "non_data_encoding" )->first_node( "quietzone_left" )->first_node( "CodaBar" );
00140         returnedData = node->value( );
00141         
00142         int width = atoi( returnedData.c_str( ) );
00143         vector< int > *pattern = new vector< int >;
00144         pattern->push_back( width );
00145         
00146         Symbol *quietSymbol = createSymbol( 2, 1, 1, 0, pattern );
00147         BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( quietSymbol, 0 );
00148         BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( quietSymbol, BaseBarcode::encodedSymbols.size( ) );
00149 }

00156 vector< int >* Codabar::stringToVector( string aString )
00157 {
00158         vector< int > *pattern = new vector< int >;
00159         for ( int ll = 0; ll < aString.length( ) ; ll++)
00160         {
00161                 char eachCharFromResult = aString.at( ll );
00162                 int temp = atoi( &eachCharFromResult );
00163                 temp++; //** to bring it up to standard 1 for narrow, 2X...NX for wide **
00164                 pattern->push_back( temp );
00165         }
00166         return pattern;
00167 }
